Images.Name: i0
Images.Description: Human FFPE Tonsil Imaged with CellScape

Header:
Our CellScape Precise Spatial Multiplexing instrument is a whole-slide, high-plex imaging platform that enables deep phenotyping of tissues with unmatched data quality. Individually phenotype every single cell in your sample while maintaining spatial and morphological information. 

Explore a formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) hyperplastic tonsil specimen stained with components of our VistaPlex Spatial Immune Profiling Kit and see how high resolution and high dynamic range image capture enable visualization of previously undetectable biology.

Waypoints.Name: Massive Viewing Window
Waypoints.Description:
View your entire sample with the CellScape Whole-Slide Imaging Chamber,  compatible with any standard histology microscope slide (25 mm by 75 mm). 

The tonsil biopsy shown here is 8.14 mm x 9.54 mm, for a total scanned area of 78.1 square mm. As this entire specimen utilized only ~10% of the available imaging window, more technical replicates or additional samples could be explored on the same slide with no additional reagents.

Waypoints.Name: Phenotyping Based on Expression Level
Waypoints.Description:
CellScape utilizes High Dynamic Range (HDR) imaging to enable detection of weakly labelled cells without capturing oversaturated pixels from strongly labelled cells in the same field of view. The relative quantification of fluorescence signal also enables stratification of cell types based on levels of biomarker expression rather than a binary (expressed/not expressed) output.

Because of HDR image capture, PD-L1+/-, CD4(low) CD3- monocytes can be easily differentiated from CD4(high), CD3+ T-cells in the tonsillar mucosa-associated lymphoid region. See arrows 1-5 for both detailed immune cell phenotyping and observation of cell-cell interactions.

Arrows.Text: Monocyte (PD-L1-).
Monocyte (PD-L1+).
T-cell.

Waypoints.Name: HDR Capture of a Wide Dynamic Range Ki67 Signal Illustrates the Cell Cycle
Waypoints.Description:
Multiple exposures are necessary to properly visualize the full range of biologically relevant Ki67 expression without under- or over-saturation. With the power of HDR, CellScape captures and overlays the relevant exposures, enabling visualization of both Ki67 intensity and morphology in all stages of cell cycle. 

Start exploring the impact of HDR by toggling on/off the "Ki67-high" vs. "Ki67-low" channels which will allow you to properly visualize ALL Ki67+ cells in ALL stages of the cell cycle.

Arrows.Text: Ki67-high.
Ki67-high.
Ki67-low.
Ki67-low.

Waypoints.Group: Cell Division Ki67 Low vs High

Waypoints.Name: HDR Enables Detection of all Biologically Relevant Fluorescence Values
Waypoints.Description:
HDR image capture distinguishes between PD-L1+ CD4(low) monocytes embedded in the tonsillar epithelium and CD4(high) T-cells in the tonsillar mucosal associated lymphoid region. High resolution HDR image capture also enables the detection of fine cellular protrusions and marker polarization indicative of cellular activity. 

Here, we detected processes consistent with initiation of adaptive immunity, including the accumulation of PD-L1 on the leading edge of a CD4(low) monocyte.

Arrows.Text: 1. The accumulation of PD-L1 on the leading edge of the CD4(low) monocyte indicates migration of the monocyte from PanCK+ crypts into the CD20+ B-cell rich mucosal associated lymphoid region. This monocyte may mature into a dendritic cell located in a germinal center.

Waypoints.Name: Simultaneous Capture of Bright and Dim PD-L1 Signal
Waypoints.Description:
HDR imaging allows for the simultaneous capture of both dim and bright PD-L1 from immune-privileged epithelial cells as well as germinal center immune cells which stain up to two orders of magnitude brighter. 

Here, toggle the CD45 and PanCK channels to view both dim PD-L1 signal expressed in PanCK+ epithelial cells and bright PD-L1 signal associated with CD45+ CD68+ dendritic cells.

Arrows.Text: Bright PD-L1+ CD45+ immune cell.
Bright PD-L1+ CD45+ immune cell.
Dim PD-L1+ PanCK+ epithelial cell.
Bright PD-L1+ CD45+ CD68+ follicular dendritic cell.

Waypoints.Name: Visualization of Direct Cell-Cell Interactions
Waypoints.Description:
The combination of HDR imaging and high caliber optics enables CellScape to capture key biochemical processes in action. Visualizing cell-cell interactions with high-resolution microscopy is crucial for understanding cellular communication, disease mechanisms, and immune responses.

Here, the polarization of high PD-L1 signal in the processes of CD68+ follicular dendritic cells indicates the presentation of antigens to CD4+ and CD8+ T-Cells. The presence of CD45RO in T-Cells in direct contact with dendritic cell processes confirms their active state.

Arrows.Text: CD4+ T-cell with CD45RO confirms priming.
3. CD8+ T cell interacting with CD68+ dendritic cell.
Activation of T-cells by a CD68+ follicular dendritic cell can be seen via strong PD-L1 signal in the plasma membrane.
High PD-L1 localized between the membranes of the CD4+ T-cell and CD68+ follicular dendritic cell indicates a direct interaction between the cells.
CD68 is isolated to the cytosol while PD-L1 is only present in the membrane of this follicular dendritic cell.

Waypoints.Name: Capturing Biological Variance Across Entire Tissue
Waypoints.Description:
Spatial context is paramount. Imaging larger tissue sections provides the opportunity to capture more biological information, including more variance.

The large hyperplastic tonsil section presents multiple tonsillar crypts, where the epithelia of the oral cavity interfaces with mucosal-associated lymphoid tissue and then germinal centers. Each crypt interface is unique.

Featured here are tonsillar crypt interfaces with disorganized epithelia comprised primarily of CD20+ cells and highly enriched in PD-L1 (arrow 1), as well as a region where the epithelial barrier is highly organized and PD-L1 is less pronounced (arrow 2), and a region where the epithelial barrier is limited to a single layer of flat squamous PanCK+ cells (arrow 3).

Arrows.Text: 1. A tonsillar crypt interface high in CD20 and PD-L1 among disorganized PanCK+ epithelial cells.
2. Tight, intercalated PanCK+ epithelial barrier with low PD-L1.
3. Flat monolayer of PanCK+ squamous epithelium.

Waypoints.Name: Free Explore
Waypoints.Description: Pan and zoom to explore this tissue freely.

Groups.Name: Cell Division Ki67 Low vs High
